title: Fish Tacos With Cabbage And Lime
summary: Fish Tacos With Cabbage And Lime is a gluten free and pescatarian main course. This recipe serves 3 and costs $5.72 per serving. One portion of this dish contains approximately 39g of protein, 19g of fat, and a total of 557 calories. 39 people have tried and liked this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 45 minutes. A couple people really liked this Mexican dish. A mixture of tilapia fillets, olive oil, onion, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. To use up the sour cream you could follow this main course with the Sour Cream Apple Pie as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 99%. This score is spectacular. Try Fish Tacos with Cabbage and Lime, Fish Tacos with Cabbage and Lime, and Spicy Fish Tacos with Cabbage Slaw + Lime Crema for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Chehalem 3 Vineyard Pinot Gris with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 26 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Chehalem 3 Vineyard Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: A blend of three great vineyards, this vivid grape crafts a food-friendly wine, bright and pure. Gray it isn't. The knife-edged acid, with pear, lemon sorbet, spice and jasmine makes your mouth water and your hands shake.
